posts.title: UNSD is getting ready for World Statistics Day
posts.text:
Preparations at the [UN Statistics Division](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/default.htm) for World Statistics Day are well underway. Pedestrians on First Avenue are greeted by our smiley statistician when walking past the entrance to the UN Secretariat building in New York. Staff are now busy updating the official [https://worldstatisticsday.org](https://worldstatisticsday.org/) website with news and information shared by countries and other partners about the many events they are planning to join the celebration. Also, UNSD staff will celebrate World Statistics Day with a social gathering, at which they will create a time capsule to be opened on World Statistics Day 2030.

posts.title: National Statistics Institute of Spain celebrates with two conferences
posts.text:
The [National Statistics Institute of Spain (INE)] (http://www.ine.es) will celebrate World Statistics Day with two main events. posts.title: Irish Central Statistics Office engages with students of all ages though a professional exhibition and at Ireland's Maths Week
posts.text:
The [Irish Central Statistics Office (CSO)] (http://www.cso.ie/) is celebrating World Statistics Day with a number of activities. Firstly, the CSO has partnered with the [Portuguese Exploristica] (http://www.exploristica.com/) team to bring Exploristica, an engaging, interactive set of educational games, to Ireland. The CSO has partnered with the [Lifetime Labs] (http://www.lifetimelab.ie/) in Cork to curate this exhibition and will launch this project on World Statistics Day. Initially, Exploristica will be exhibited in the Lifetime Labs, but, it is easily transportable so it will make a tour of Ireland through regular annual events like the [BT Young Scientist] (http://btyoungscientist.com/) and [SciFest] (http://scifest.ie/) as well as being curated in other cities.

 Secondly, CSO will publish our [Statistical Yearbook of Ireland 2015] (http://www.cso.ie/en/releasesandpublications/statisticalyearbookofireland/) on World Statistics Day. The Statistical Yearbook of Ireland 2015 presents a comprehensive picture of Ireland today. It provides detailed information, tables and graphs across a wide range of topics. These include the population, labour market, education, crime, the economy, agriculture, industry, services, prices, housing, and the environment. The yearbook is published as a mobile friendly web publication.

 Thirdly, the CSO will partner with [University College Cork] (http://www.ucc.ie) to present a series of short presentations on statistical topics of interest. Statistics will engage the audience will topics like open data and big data and will provide a window to our statistics products and services as well as our wealth of data.

 World Statistics Day will build on the CSO outreach work in [Maths Week] (http://www.mathsweek.ie/), taking place a week earlier in Ireland where over a quarter of a million students engage in all things mathematical. During Maths Week the CSO Director General Padraig Dalton will launch our new [CensusAtSchool questionnaire] (http://www.censusatschool.ie/en/take-part/questionnaires/phase15-16), Felix Coleman, a CSO statistician, will publish the finding of the CensusAtSchool 2014/2015 questionnaire. Minister Damien Engliah TD, Minister of State for Skills, Research and Innovation will launch our [statistical poster competition] (http://www.cso.ie/en/studentscorner/johnhoopermedalforstatisticscompetition/) and our [app building competition](http://apps4gaps.ie/). In addition, there will be lots of engagement at school level with themed school visits.

 Ireland has an exciting two weeks ahead with World Statistics Day and Maths week creating plenty of opportunities to engage.

posts.title: Statistics Sweden will launch its new website “Sweden in Figures” on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
To celebrate World Statistics Day, [Statistics Sweden](http://www.scb.se) is launching the website [Sverige i siffror (Sweden in Figures)] (http://www.scb.se/sverigeisiffror/). Statistics Sweden created a new concept to make their data available to a broader audience. Information technologies have driven changes in the ways users want to consume statistics. With the increasing flow of information, users need to get information quickly before digging deeper into reports and databases. Information needs to be simple to find, fast to interpret, and easy to dig deeper into.

 In addition to the website, Statistics Sweden has developed a teacher’s guide and a booklet.

posts.title: The Department of Census and Statistics of Sri Lanka is adding a high level World Statistics Day Forum to its extensive programme for World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Department of Census and Statistics](http://www.statistics.gov.lk/) of Sri Lanka has extended its already extensive programme in celebration for World Statistics Day 2015. The Department will organize a World Statistics Day Forum 2015, which will be held on 20 October 2015 in Colombo, with the participation of the decision makers of the Island. The Forum will showcase the achievements of the Department of Census and Statistics of Sri Lanka and will present how data users use data for making informed decisions.

 Other activities include Statistical Literacy Seminars, which will be conducted for GCE (A/L) students of Government schools in Colombo District under the theme “World Statistics Day” on 15 October 2015 and Seminar for Journalists, which will be held on 18 October 2015, to enhance statistical awareness. Special School Assemblies will also be held Island wide on 20 October 2015, to pass the message on “Better data. Better lives”. Seminars for District level officers will be held on 20 October 2015, with the aim of enhancing statistical awareness and appreciating their support to the work of statisticians.

posts.title: How George Boole’s legacy enables the Information Society and is central to better data for better lives
posts.text:
The [Permanent Mission of Ireland to the United Nations] (https://www.dfa.ie/pmun/newyork/) and [University College Cork] (http://www.ucc.ie/en/) are organizing a Panel Discussion on issues related to World Summit on the [Information Society (WSIS)] (www.wsis.org/) entitled [“How George Boole’s legacy enables the Information Society and is central to better data for better lives”](files/WSIS Boole Invitation from Ireland.pdf). Topics include: “The Life and Legacy of George Boole”, “ICT for Development”, “Big Data for Development” and “Big Data and Human Rights”. The event will take place on 20 October 2015, 6:30pm at UNHQ (ECOSOC Chamber).

 [A screening of a documentary on George Boole at 5pm in Conference Room 12 will precede the panel discussion](blog.html?i=26).

 The discussion will be followed by a reception at the Permanent Mission of Ireland.

posts.title: Eurostat celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[Eurostat] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main) is the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg. Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions. Eurostat will celebrate this year's World Statistics Day with a news release and a short video, which will be published on Monday 19 October. Both will focus on the global theme “Better data. Better lives.” In the news release, Eurostat will highlight the links between its data and the priorities of the European Commission as set out in the recent publication [“European Statistics for European Policies”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/4031688/7008709/KS-04-15-397-EN-N/).

 Nowadays European statistics are used in many different ways by a growing number of people.

 ![Eurostat](img/posts/Eurostat_users.png)

 In addition, the release will highlight recent work with a link to the lives of European citizens, such as [“Sustainable development in the European Union”](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6987735/KS-GU-15-001-EN-N.pdf/), [“The EU in the World”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6975194/KS-EX-15-001-EN-N.pdf/), [“Quality of life – Facts and views”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6856423/KS-05-14-073-EN-N/), [“Being young in Europe today“] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6776245/KS-05-14-031-EN-N.pdf/) and [“Smarter, greener, more inclusive? – Indicators to support the Europe 2020 strategy”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6655013/KS-EZ-14-001-EN-N.pdf/).

posts.title: World Statistics Day Celebration 2015 in Curaçao
posts.text:
The [Central Bureau of Statistics Curaçao (CBS)] (http://www.cbs.cw/) intends to celebrate World Statistics Day this year in the following way:

posts.text:

Leshner from [Planet Labs] (https://www.planet.com) will talk about “Using Space to Help Life on Earth”; Anthony Vanky from [MIT Senseable City Lab] (http://senseable.mit.edu) will focus on “When Communities Talk Back: Data & Vizualization in the “Senseable City” and Hermann Habermann from the [National Academies of Sciences] (http://sites.nationalacademies.org/DBASSE/CNSTAT/index.htm) will look at “New Directions in the Use of Data”.

posts.title: Second Global Conference on Big Data for Official Statistics will take place on 20-22 October in Abu Dhabi
posts.text:
The [Second Global Conference on Big Data for Official Statistics] (http://unstats.un.org/unsd/trade/events/2015/abudhabi/default.asp) opens on 20 October 2015, which happens to be World Statistics Day. This day is celebrated all over the world under the general theme of “Better data. Better lives.” What better way of celebrating World Statistics Day than by highlighting the benefits of Big Data for Better Lives. Innovations in technology, widespread penetration of electronic devices, and the rapid rise in the use of technology for social purposes all bring fundamental changes to the availability of real-time information. Such massive, highly dynamic and weakly structured data is commonly referred to as Big Data.

 Recognizing the potential of Big Data, the UN Statistical Commission established in 2014 a global working group (GWG) [http://unstats.un.org/unsd/bigdata/] to provide strategic vision, direction and coordination of Big Data for official statistics. This is the 2nd Conference of the GWG, which will take the use of Big Data one step further from examples to guidance, and from pilot projects to production.

posts.title: Oman joins the celebrations

posts.title: World Statistics Day 2015 in Myanmar
posts.text:
World Statistics Day 2015 will be celebrated in Myanmar on 20 October through a commemorative event that will bring together producers and users of statistics from government, civil society, the private sector, media, and international organizations.

 The event will be opened by the Vice President of Myanmar, H.E. U Nyan Tun, and include a senior-level panel discussion on the theme of this year’s World Statistics Day “Better  Data. Better Lives.” Moreover, the new website for disseminating official statistics online will be launched and showcased at the event: [MMSIS - Myanmar Statistical Information Service] (http://www.mmsis.gov.mm). In the afternoon, attendants of the event will have the opportunity to follow three panel discussions, covering: (1) macroeconomic statistics, (2) agriculture, trade and investment statistics, and (3) social and vital statistics.

 In celebrating World Statistics Day, Myanmar acknowledges the efforts of all producers and users of quality statistics in the country, and celebrates all the recent achievements in the development of statistics, including the drafting of a new statistical policy brief, a new statistics law, the development of a National Strategy for the Development of Statistics, and a multitude of recent statistical operations, including the [Population Census (2014)] (http://www.mmsis.gov.mm/sub_menu/statistics/fileDb.jsp?code_code=003) and ongoing improvements in the fields of labor statistics, business statistics, trade statistics, price statistics, and others.

posts.title: What do we know of the world’s refugees?
posts.text:
[Statistics Norway] (http://www.ssb.no) will mark this year's World Statistics Day with a breakfast seminar. Statistics Norway will present the statistics the office has on refugees and discuss global challenges with collecting and presenting statistics on refugees.

 The [Norwegian Refugee Council] (http://www.nrc.no/) will speak of the need for international comparative statistics on refugees, the [Norwegian Directorate of Immigration] (http://www.udi.no/) will talk about the number of refugees coming to Norway. The seminar will also highlight the need for developing a set of international recommendations on refugee statistics.

posts.title: Statistical Office of the Slovak Republic will celebrate with a series of events, including an open house, a quiz and a conference
posts.text:
[The Statistical Office of the Slovak Republic (SOSR)] (http://slovak.statistics.sk) is joining the World Statistics Day celebration with various activities and events.

 The Open Day of the SOSR is the main activity and will take place on 20 October 2015 at the headquarters and in all regional offices. Visitors have the opportunity to learn information on statistical work through short presentations on selected statistical topics, to gain promotional documents and publications and to familiarize with the new internet portal and statistical databases. The set of specialized presentations is prepared for invited group of users. A [flyer] (http://slovak.statistics.sk/wps/wcm/connect/5fef378e-b749-4669-af77-3315db7670c0/Svetovy_den_statistiky_AJ.pdf?MOD=AJPERES) has been created for this event.

 SOSR is also preparing an electronic quiz for users focused on testing statistical knowledge and skills in searching information on the portal and in databases of the SOSR. The quiz will be available from 15 October unitl 15 November 2015.

 A Conference on “Electronic Services of the Statistical Office” will be held on 21 October 2015 hosting invited experts. The main aim of the event is to present the results of the national project of the Office.

 There are planned internal activities for the staff of the Office as well, e.g. Sports Day and the award “Young Statistician of the year” as the motivation for young employees to active statistical work.

 More information on SOSR activities is available on the portal.

posts.title: Statistics Portugal will celebrate the World Statistics Day 2015 with a Seminar on “Sustainable Development Goals: The challenges for the statistical community.”
posts.text:
[Statistics Portugal] (http://www.ine.pt/) celebrates the World Statistics Day 2015 with a Seminar on “Sustainable Development Goals: The challenges for the statistical community.” The objective is to raise awareness of the importance and critical aspects concerning the formulation and development of a successful Sustainable Development Goals indicator framework. And, in particular, of the challenges that the statistical community must address in order to develop a technically rigorous indicator framework, meeting the requirements of the monitoring of [the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld), at global, regional and national levels. 

 The event is open to society, including key stakeholders, opinion makers and media, and will benefit from the views of statistics experts and of renowned researchers on the matter. The programme is available in [English] (http://www.ine.pt/ine_novidades/semin/programa_A4_ING_.pdf) and [Portuguese] (http://www.ine.pt/xportal/xmain?xpid=INE&xpgid=ine_sem_lista&tipo=r&detalhe=242683525)

posts.title: Swami Rama Himalayan University is conducting their First Annual Symposium on Clinical Biostatistics on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
On the occasion of World Statistics Day, the [Department of Community Medicine, Himalayan Institute of Medical Sciences] (http://www.srhu.edu.in/academics/schools-colleges/himalayan-institute-of-medical-sciences.html) of the [Swami Rama Himalayan University] (http://www.srhu.edu.in/) is conducting the First Annual Symposium on Clinical Biostatistics on 20 October 2015 under the theme of: “Application of Bio statistical methods in Epidemiological study designs”.

 The annual symposium on Clinical Bio-Statistics 2015 is a scientific forum for national exchange of theory, methods and applications of biostatistics in medical research and practice. It will enable participants to know the pre requisites for application of various statistical methods and to select the appropriate test for the study designs as well as interpretation. For more information click [here](files/CME_final_3.pdf). 

 The symposium is intended for statisticians, clinicians and members of other disciplines, such as epidemiologists, clinical chemists and clinical pharmacologists, nursing & other paramedical staff, interested in the field of clinical biostatistics.

posts.title: Israeli Central Bureau of Statistics celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[The Israeli Central Bureau of Statistics] (http://www.cbs.gov.il) will put emphasis on measuring well-being and sustainable development goals to promote evidence-based and, therefore, effective decision-making. 

 During the weekly Cabinet Meeting, the Government Statistician of Israel is scheduled to present a review of the structure and functions of the [Central Bureau of Statistics] (http://www.cbs.gov.il) and the importance of the use of official statistics in the government decision-making process. 

 The Public Council for Statistics will mark this day in a special meeting of its 60 members, in which key speakers will present the strategic plan of the government of Israel, and the work done defining well-being indicators that will be monitored to serve the plan. Directors of research centers in the Knesset and in public institutes will present evidence-based decision-making in their organizations.

 The [Israel Statistical Association] (http://www.statistics.org.il/) initiated the updating of statistical entries in Wikipedia, for example “The Government Statistician”, “Public Council for Statistics” and “The Statistics Ordinance”. 

 The Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) will launch a new yearbook which summarizes the main statistical information on Israel. CBS staff has contributed an article to [Significance Magazine](http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance) [(of RSS and ASA)] (https://worldstatisticsday.org/blog.html?o=RSS) “Magical Mirror: Improving foreign trade in the Middle East”, to be published in a special issue dedicated to World Statistics Day.  In addition, the CBS has prepared special publications related to WSD to be shared with the press and social media to mark this special day.

posts.title: Qatar will announce the results of the 2015 simplified Population, Housing and Establishments Census at the World Statistics Day Forum in Doha
posts.text:
The Ministry of Development Planning and Statistics launched an extensive [programme] (files/MDPS_plan_Arabic.pdf) to celebrate World Statistics Day. The main event will be the “World Statistics Day Forum” to be held at the Grand Hyatt Hotel, Doha, under the patronage of His Excellency Sheikh Abdullah Bin Nasser Bin Khalifa AI-Thani, Prime Minister and Minister of Interior. A dedicated [website] (http://www.mdps.gov.qa/statsDay15/) is available in Arabic and English.

 His Excellency the Minister of Development Planning and Statistics give a press conference focussing on the importance of official statistics and their role in the formulation of development strategies as well as the role of government agencies and corporations supporting the Ministry in the compilation of accurate data.

 Various advocacy materials, such as banners, [posters] (files/WSD_poster_Qatar.pdf), brochures and a newsletter are being prepared.

posts.title: Monaco Statistics will celebrate World Statistics Day

posts.title: World Statistics Day 2015 in Mongolia
posts.text:
To celebrate World Statistics Day, the following [activities] (https://www.un.int/mongolia/news/world-statistics-day-2015-mongolia) will be organized in Mongolia:

 [The National Statistical Office of Mongolia] (http://nso.mn) will organize a series of events under the theme “World Statistics Day” for students from the national and private universities, studying statistics and economies, on 16 October 2015. posts.title: Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics will hold an international event to celebrate World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
The [Palestinian Bureau of Statistics (PCBS)](http://pcbs.gov.ps/default.aspx) launches the [web site](http://www.pcbs.gov.ps/wsd-2015/en-us/) for its celebration of the World Statistics Day that will take place on 20 October 2015. The website is designed to document the celebration and promote statistics in Palestine. In addition, PCBS seizes this opportunity to promote its practices of social responsibility as well as its dissemination means of official statistics.

posts.title: The Royal Statistical Society Celebrates World Statistics Day with a number of initiatives
posts.text:
[The Royal Statistical Society (RSS)] (http://www.statslife.org.uk) will mark the second World Statistics Day on 20 October with a number of [initiatives] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/news/2499-rss-commemorates-world-statistics-day), including a statement, a reception in London for RSS fellows, statistics training for Members of Parliaments and a special edition of their flagship magazine [Significance] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance).

 The RSS has issued a [statement] (http://www.rss.org.uk/RSS/Influencing_Change/World_Statistics_Day_statement/RSS/Influencing_Change/World_Statistics_Day_statement.aspx?hkey=c261be5f-4079-4392-aa0e-35f6021aee6c) with the [International Statistical Institute (ISI)] (http://www.isi-web.org) and the [American Statistical Association (ASA)] (www.amstat.org) , to which more than 40 other organisations have signed up. It calls for 'a true data revolution' in order to properly be able to measure progress against the UN's ambitious new [Sustainable Development Goals] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld). The statement urges that the opportunities provided by new technology and big data are properly utilised, emphasising that national statistical systems are central to this effort. To this end, the statement continues, 'systems must be properly financed, the development of statistical skills and expertise must be supported, and access to new tools and technology must be provided.'

 On the evening of WSD, the RSS is hosting a [reception] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/events/events-calendar/eventdetail/501/-/royal-statistical-society-celebrates-world-statistics-day-2015) for members and supporters of the society, as well as from partner organisations we have worked with throughout the past year. The event will include short speeches by the national statistician John Pullinger and Claire Melamed from the Overseas Development Institute who wrote a recent [report] (http://www.undatarevolution.org/report/) for the UN Secretary General on a ‘data revolution’ for international development. A number of local [events] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/events/events-calendar) are also planned for the day.

 20 October also happens to be the day that the RSS’ training for Members of Parliament will take place in parliament following our [Parliament Counts campaign] (http://www.rss.org.uk/rss/influencing_change/lobby_election_candidates/rss/influencing_change/lobby_election_candidates.aspx?hkey=51a5581b-e36f-4f6b-92d0-8e9299133fcd). The campaign sent thousands of messagesbto candidates around the country during the election campaign earlier in 2015, resulting in 324 candidates across the political spectrum signing up to the campaign, of which 55 are now elected members of parliament.

 Finally, the RSS will publish a World Statistics Day issue issue of [Significance magazine] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance) with six articles, all focusing on the importance of measuring sustainable development, all being made open access for a limited time from 20 October onwards. Claire Melamed will talk about how close we are to achieving a 'data revolution', while other articles focus on how statistics have been employed to examine issues as diverse as undernourishment, slavery and trends in travel.

posts.title: Creative workshop with students at Statistics Lithuania
posts.text:
On 6 October [Statistics Lithuania] (http://www.stat.gov.lt/en/home) organised a creative statistics and design workshop, dedicated to the commemoration of the World Statistics Day. The workshop was attended by 36 second-year students of [the Vilnius College of Technologies and Design] (http://www.dizainokolegija.lt/lt/) – to familiarise themselves with official statistics and, with the help of statisticians, to create infographics, presenting a statistical message in an attractive manner.

 At the beginning of the event, the students received information about the World Statistics Day, familiarised themselves with Statistics Lithuania, the main principles behind the production and dissemination of official statistics, the Official Statistics Portal, the Database of Indicators, etc.

 After a lunchbreak, work proceeded in small (four-student) groups. A statistician joined each group; the statistician helped the students to better understand the statistical domain selected, discover interesting statistics and come to a solution how to visualise them via infographics. For many students, it was not an easy task. “I had no idea that statistics covers such a wide range of topics. I am totally lost.”, said one of the participants. However, after three hours of intensive work, all student groups presented the first draft infographics.

 After the creative workshop, future designers will continue working individually and finalise the infographics by the World Statistics Day, commemorated on 20 October.

 “Our cooperation with the Vilnius College of Technologies and Design dates back many years. This mutual work provides students an opportunity to scrutinise an almost unfamiliar area, learn to find information in the abundance of data, use the Official Statistics Portal. As for our specialists, it is a great opportunity for them to try to explain complicated things in a simple language, look at the results of their work from a user's perspective”, said the Director General of Statistics Lithuania Vilija Lapėnienė in her introductory speech.

 More information on the event can be found [here](http://www.stat.gov.lt/en/home/-/asset_publisher/lbrXvLVHX2ln/content/studentu-kurybines-dirbtuves-lietuvos-statistikos-departamente?redirect=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.stat.gov.lt%2Fen%2Fhome%3Fp_p_id%3D101_INSTANCE_lbrXvLVHX2ln%26p_p_lifecycle%3D0%26p_p_state%3Dnormal%26p_p_mode%3Dview%26p_p_col_id%3Dcolumn-3%26p_p_col_count%3D1).

posts.title: UNIDO Celebrates World Statistics Day with a seminar on Measuring progress of nations in inclusive and sustainable industrialization
posts.text:
Around 50 national and international statisticians will be gathering at the Vienna International Centre from 14-16 October to celebrate World Statistics Day on the margins of an international seminar on the role of industrial statistics in the global monitoring of the sustainable development goals. The seminar is organized by the [Statistics Unit] (http://www.unido.org/statistics.html?ucg_no64=1%2Fdata%2Findex.php) of the [UN Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)] (http://www.unido.org).

 In September the UN General assembly adopted the [2030 Sustainable Development Agenda] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld) shaping the international development agenda for the period till 2030. Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 9 is related to sustainable industrialization. UNIDO promotes the [Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development (ISID)] (https://isid.unido.org) around the world. [Industrial Statistics] (https://www.unido.org/en/resources/statistics/statistical-databases.html) will be instrumental in global monitoring of the progress of nations towards the achievement of industrialization.

 The World Statistics Day celebration will provide an excellent forum to commence a new task of industrial statistics in an atmosphere of cordiality, intellectual exercise and professional unity. Around 50 national and international statisticians have already confirmed their participation. Many of them will present their research papers covering the measurement issues on industrial growth, social inclusiveness and the impact of industrial production on environment.

posts.title: University of South Queensland to host two guest speakers on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[The University of Southern Queensland (USQ)] (http://usq.edu.au) in Toowoomba will celebrate World Statistics Day 2015 by hosting Dr. Neil Gordon of the [Defence Science & Technology Group] (http://www.dsto.defence.gov.au) based in Adelaide and Dr. Ross Darnell, principal research scientist at the [Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation] (http://www.csiro.au), Brisbane. [Click here] (files/WSD_Australia.pdf) for the detailed program.

 Gordon, who was part of the Australian team to search for missing [Malaysian Airline] (http://www.malaysiaairlines.com) Flight MH370, will speak on “Bayesian Statistics and the Search for Flight MH370”. On 7 March 2014, MH370 carrying 239 passengers and crew from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing lost contact with air traffic control and was subsequently reported missing. In his talk, Gordon, a member of the [Australian Transport Safety Bureau] (http://www.atsb.gov.au) search advisory team, will show how Bayesian statistical estimation methods have been used to process the [Inmarsat] (http://www.inmarsat.com/) data and produce a probability distribution of MH370 flight paths that defines the current search zone in the southern Indian Ocean.

 Darnell will present a talk titled “Data Literacy in a World of Big Data”. There is an increasingly large amount of data available either publicly or available to scientists across the globe. Making honest predictions from these data is not necessarily determined by quantity. Even large datasets can be generated with limitations that define their quality. In his talk, Darnell will argue data scientists need to be trained to understand these limitations of empirical evidence.

 In the opening session, Professor Shahjahan Khan, the event organiser, will provide a brief introduction on “Why World Statistics Day?”

posts.title: DESA News article highlights central role of statistics for sustainable development

posts.title: International Civil Aviation Organization will celebrate World Statistics Day with a workshop

posts.title: Azerbaijan State Statistical Committee celebrates with competition for journalists and a brand new journal “Statistical News”
posts.text:

Better lives.” It is sponsored by [the State Statistical Committee] (http://www.stat.gov.az/indexen.php) and the State Fund for the Support of Mass Media Development under the President of the Republic of Azerbaijan. posts.title: Poland will celebrate with a focus on community statistics

posts.title: The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics will be launched on the World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
As part of the celebrations for the World Statistics Day 2015, the permanent missions of Japan and Mexico to the United Nations are joinly hosting a panel discussion for the launch of the publication “The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics.”

This event will take place on Tuesday, 20 October 2015, from 11:30am-1:00pm, in Conference Room 6 at the UN Headquarters in New York.

The list of speakers in this event will include: 

- Opening by Ambassador, Permanent Representative of Japan to the United Nations

- Key findings from The World’s Women 2015, by Ms. Francesca Grum, Chief of the Social and Housing Statistics Section, United Nations Statistics Division

- Women and Universal Health Coverage in the Era of Global Ageing, by Ms. Reiko Hayashi, Director of the Department of International Research and Cooperation, National Institute of Population and Social Security Research (IPSS), Japan

- Measuring Violence against Women in Mexico, by Mr. Félix Vélez Fernández Varela, Vice President of INEGI Governing Board, Mexico.

The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics is the sixth edition in a series of reports produced by the United Nations Statistics Division every five years as called for specifically in the Beijing Platform for Action adopted at the Fourth World Conference on Women in 1995.

The eight chapters of the report cover several critical areas of policy concerns identified in the 1995 Beijing Platform for Action: population and families; health; education; work; power and decision-making; violence against women; environment; and poverty. In each area, a life-cycle approach is used to reveal the experiences of women and men during different periods of life – from childhood and the formative years, through the working and reproductive stages, to older ages.

For additional information and RSVP by 16 October 2015 (required for non-UN pass holders), please contact [Ms. Harumi Shibata] (mailto:shibata@un.org).

posts.title: International Seminar on World Statistics Day 2015 in Peru will focus on ethnicity data
posts.text:
On the occasion of World Statistics Day, [Peru’s National Statistical Office](http://www.inei.gob.pe/) is organizing an International Seminar to discuss the management of ethnicity variables in national censuses, surveys and administrative records. The seminar will take place in Lima on 20-21 October 2015.

 The development of solid statistical methodologies to collect and analyze data on ethnicity is a topic of particular importance this year, as the international statistical community works to define a new indicator framework to follow up and review the implementation of a newly adopted [2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld). Among other things, this indicator framework will require the collection of disaggregated data to ensure that no one is left behind, including ethnic and other vulnerable population groups.

 It is expected that the event will be inaugurated by the President of Peru, Mr. Ollanta Humala, and will count with international and national participants, including statisticians, decision makers, researchers, and organizations.

posts.title: Hungary launches an extensive year-round programme in commemoration of World Statistics Day

##### A panel discussion in the HCSO under the motto  “Better data. Better lives”.

 Celebrations began on 18 September with a panel discussion in the Hungarian Central Statistical Office on “the practical use and value of statistical data”. The event was live broadcast through a link on the HCSO website.

##### “Doors open” days in the Hungarian Central Statistical Office 

 On 19-20 September 2015, in conjunction with the event series of the Cultural Heritage Days, the ‘Palace of Statistics’ once again opened its doors. The building located at 5-7 Keleti Károly Street is one of the few still used for the purpose for which it was designed. During the weekend, an exhibition of statistical curiosities, a games corner and a discounted book fair awaited visitors.

 [The HCSO library] (http://konyvtar.ksh.hu/index.php?s=fejlesztesalatt_en) also opened its doors. It has a collection of 850 thousand publications. Visitors had the chance to become familiar with the reading rooms, the movable bookshelves in the library’s compact storage area and the prestigious office of the director-general; they could browse old maps and publications once declared to be secret; furthermore, they could join the library for a discounted charge.

##### International conference celebrating World Statistics Day 2015

 The Hungarian Central Statistical Office, together with [the Hungarian Academy of Sciences] (http://www.mta.hu) and [the Hungarian Statistical Association] (http://isi.cbs.nl/statsoc/hungary2.htm), is organizing an international conference in Budapest on 20-21 October 2015. The topic is “Official statistics: New opportunities for transformation – innovation and cooperation”. 

 The conference aims to identify the main concerns and find answers to how producers of official statistics and institutions of higher education can respond in order to satisfy the rightful needs of our users on the short, medium and long term. Being aware of the complexity of the phenomenon, the conference will be addressed in a plenary session, followed by round-table discussions, which will be dedicated to five key aspects, namely:

* Sustainability of statistics: from data sources to the image of official statistics;
* Microdata exchange in international trade, migration and banking statistics;
* Human Resources Management and organisational modernisation;
* Training the new generations and rejuvenating the older generations of statisticians;
* Dissemination and communication. 
# 

 For a tentative programme [click here] (./files/20151002_HUN_Preliminary_Programme.pdf). The event will be live broadcast online to facilitate the sharing of knowledge and ideas as widely as possible. The recordings will be made available on Youtube.

##### Events at regional level 

 Connected to the events of World Statistics Day 2015, the Veszprém Department of the Hungarian Central Statistical Office, as well as the Chamber of Commerce of Veszprém County and the Europe Direct Information Centre of Veszprém County, will organise a team competition entitled 'Who knows more about the world of statistics?' for students studying in grades 10-13 of secondary schools in Veszprém county.

 The Hungarian Central Statistical Office is planning to continue organising further events related to World Statistics Day 2015 in the course of the following year.

posts.title: Anguilla Statistics Department celebrates “Statistics Week 2015”
posts.text:
Anguilla will celebrate “Statistics Week 2015” during the week of 11-16 October 2015 under the theme: “Empowering our nation through the use of quality statistics – Post 2015 Development Agenda”. To celebrate this as well as the [Caribbean Statistics Day (15 October 2015)] (http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm) and World Statistics Day (20 October 2015) [the Anguilla Statistics Department] (http://www.gov.ai/statistics/) has planned a number of [activities] (http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm) during this week.

 Anguilla’s week of activities is intended to raise awareness of the use of statistics in empowering individuals, communities and ultimately their nation and by extension the Caribbean and the World.

 The Anguilla Statistics Department has already launched the following pre-week:

* A Word Creation Competition – using the statement “Development agenda and data” (for all primary school aged students from grades 3 – 6);

* A Poetry Competition – using the topic “Development Agenda – The role of quality statistics” (for all secondary school aged students);

* A Digital Video Creation – using the statement “Empowering our nation through the use of quality statistics” (open to the general public).

 
All competitions opened on 21 September 2015. The student competitions close on 7 October 2015 and the Digital Video Creation closes a week later on 14 October 2015. Students are encouraged to collect rules and entry forms for the two competitions from the respective schools grade teachers. Rules and entry forms for the Digital Video Creation can be collected from the Treasury or Inland Revenue Counters, the Anguilla General Post Office or the Anguilla Statistics Department.

 Further information about the activities planned for Anguilla Statistics Week 2015 will be released during the upcoming weeks. Persons requiring additional information may contact the Anguilla Statistics Department by e-mail (<statistics@gov.ai>).

posts.title: Conference in Luxembourg to mark World Statistics Day on 20 October 2015
posts.text:
In the context of World Statistic Day 20 October 2015, a conference including a round table will be organised in Luxembourg by [STATEC] (http://www.statistiques.public.lu/fr/acteurs/statec/), the National Institute of statistics and economic studies of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, and [EUROSTAT] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat), the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg.

 The opening speech will be delivered by Mr Serge Allegrezza, Director of STATEC and Ms Mariana Kotzeva, Deputy Director General of EUROSTAT. Nico Weydert (President of LSS) will introduce the newly founded Luxembourg Statistics Society LSS). There will then follow a couple of sessions on “big data” and official statistics. To finish, a round-table will be organized with representatives of some of the most important groups of users of statistics in Luxembourg.

 Further information and details regarding registration are available at [http://www.statistiques.public.lu/fr/agenda/detail-agenda/2015/10/journeemondiale.pdf](http://www.statistiques.public.lu/fr/agenda/detail-agenda/2015/10/journeemondiale.pdf)

posts.title: Bangladesh celebrates World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
In Bangladesh the day is being jointly celebrated by [the Statistics and Informatics Division (SID) of the Ministry of Planning] (http://www.sid.gov.bd/), [the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS)] (http://www.bbs.gov.bd/) and [the Bangladesh Statistical Association (BSA)] (http://isi.cbs.nl/statsoc/bangladesh2.htm). A National Committee and a number of sub-committees have been formed comprising members from these offices to implement different programmes.

posts.title: Statistical Institute of Catalonia and the Catalan Statistical Society will celebrate World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[The Statistical Institute of Catalonia](http://www.idescat.cat/) is joining UN and other institutions in the world to celebrate the World Statistics Day 2015. We have included a [short promotional vídeo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IH4TAKZQzkc) in our web site.

 Together with the Catalan Statistical Society, we will celebrate an event on October 20 in Barcelona, where a Data Manifesto will be made públic. It will be published in our [web page](http://www.idescat.cat/institut/manifestdades/?lang=en)(link will be live starting on October 20, 20h)

posts.title: Caribbean Community celebrates the seventh annual Caribbean Statistics Day
posts.text:
15 October 2015 will mark the seventh annual observance of Caribbean Statistics Day in [the Caribbean Community (CARICOM)](http://www.caricomstats.org). This year's activities also coincide with the second observance of the United Nation's World Statistics Day on 20 October 2015.

 [Caribbean Statistics Day] (http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm) is aimed at recognizing the vital role of statistics in improving the daily lives of the peoples of our Community and in raising the profile of statistics and statisticians across the Region. The theme that has been proposed for this year is aligned with the World Statistics Day theme, namely “Better data. Better lives”. 

 Member States and Associate Members are encouraged to actively engage with stakeholders including, suppliers and users of data and specifically, schools, children and youth in general in promoting the importance of statistics to the development of the respective countries. Countries are also urged to recruit members to [the Caribbean Association of Professional Statisticians (CAPS)] (http://www.caricomstats.org/CAPS.htm).

 To learn more about how the region will celebrate Caribbean and World Statistics Day, please also visit [http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm](http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm).

posts.title: Statistics Iceland to launch its new website on World Statistics Day
posts.text: [Statistics Iceland] (http://www.statice.is) will launch its new website on World Statistics Day. The new website will feature a more user friendly web interface making statistics more accessible, better search functions and an improved functionality on tablet and mobile phones. Please be sure to check out [statice.is](http://www.statice.is) soon after World Statistics Day.

posts.title: Suriname will celebrate Caribbean Statistics Day on 15 October and World Statistics Day on 20 October
posts.text:
On [Caribbean Statistics Day, CSD] (http://www.caricomstats.org/caribbean-statistics-day-2015.htm), 15 October 2015, staff of [the General Bureau of Statistics, GBS] (http://statistics-suriname.org) will get to gather with their staff for a speech from its director, Mr. Sno, a slide show of the previous CSD celebrations and a lunch. All staff will receive a CSD/WSD polo shirt, which they are encouraged to wear to work on Caribbean Statistics Day, on World Statistics Day and every Friday for the remaining of the year.

 There will be a one day Statistics Fair, on 20 of October (WSD) from 12.00- 18.00 o’clock at the Lalla Rookh building, where the General Bureau of Statistics and other ministries will participate. [UNICEF] (http://www.unicef.org) and [the UN Development Programme] (http://undp.org) are sponsoring the data fair and the EnvironmentInfo launch. Suriname will launch their SurinameEnvironmentInfo online, and the two DevInfo databases that were launched last year will be updated. At the launch, all the stakeholders of the environment statistics publication will be invited. The launch will be on 20 of October (WSD) from 9.00-11.00 o’clock.

 Already on 29 September banners have been placed on various locations in Suriname, where WSD and the Statistics Fair will be promoted. The banners will be on display until World Statistics Day.

 On World Statistics Day, GBS staff will visit secondary schools and distribute booklets informing about the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG guide), the work of GBS (GBSINFO guide), an environment guide, and a poster with all the 17 Sustainable Development Goals. The same booklets will also be provided to the Fair visitors.

 GBS is also preparing an infomercial where the director of GBS, Mr. Sno will say a few words about Caribbean Statistics Day, World Statistics Day and the fair. In addition, Mr. Armstrong Alexis, from the UN Development Programme, one of the sponsors of the Fair, will have a infomercial saying some words about the importance of data and the Sustainable Development Goals. Both infomercials will be broadcast on television stations in the period 15 – 20 October. There will also be promotion on the radio stations and in the newspapers about celebrating World Statistics Day and the Statistics Fair.

posts.title: The Kingdom of Morocco celebrates World Statistics Day 2015 with an international seminar and a series of regional events
posts.text:
Under the High Patronage of His Majesty the King Mohammed VI, [the High Commission for Planning in Morocco] (http://hcp.ma) joins the international community to celebrate World Statistics Day on 20 October 2015 under the theme: “Better Data. Better Lives.”. In this regard, a set of activities are scheduled from 20 to 23 October, 2015 at both central level and in the 12 regions of the Kingdom.

 An international seminar will be held on 20 October 2015 in Rabat. Participants include eminent senior government officials in charge of statistical production; parliamentarian personalities; representatives of professional organizations and civil society; academics and researchers and eminent international personalities including Mr. Jean Luc Tavernier, Director of [the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France] (http://www.insee.fr/en/default.asp), Mr. Mario Pezzini, Director of [the OECD Development Centre] (http://www.oecd.org/dev/) Mr. Pedro Luis do Nascimento Silva, President of [the International Statistical Institute] (http://www.isi-web.org). Mr Walter Radermacher, Director General of [Eurostat] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat) and Mr. Enrico Giovannini, former Minister of Employment and social policies, Italy, will participate through visio-conference.

 Open Days at both central level and in the 12 regions of the Kingdom will be held on 21, 22 and 23 October 2015. The program for these days includes: thematic workshops on the recent achievements of national statistical system and popularization of statistical concepts and methodologies; exhibition (technologies, websites, publications) and guided visits for pupils and students. 

 Brochures, banners, posters, roll up and other promotional items are being developed to facilitate communication.

 Last but not least, the website for the 61th World Statistics Congress of the International Statistical Institute to be held in Marrakech from 16 to 21 July 2017 (ISI2017)will be officially launched on World Statistics Day.

posts.title: National Statistical Office of the Dominican Republic celebrates World Statistics Day and its long institutional history
posts.text:
[The National Statistical Office (ONE)] (http://one.gob.do) is planning multiple events to celebrate not only World Statistics Day but also its own long and rich history in producing official statistics for the Dominican Republic. Over the course of October, ONE will hold a press conference to release two new publications and inform the media about World Statistics Day.

 ONE is also organizing an exhibition showcasing is long and rich history that reaching back to the early twentieth century using graphs and texts. There will also be a 2-D animation featuring 10 years of National Multi-Purpose Household Survey [Encuesta Nacional de Hogares y Propósitos Múltiples (ENHOGAR)] (http://www.one.gob.do/Estadisticas/216/encuesta-nacional-de-hogares-de-propositos-multiples-%28ENHOGAR%29).

 To increase visibility government institutions are invited to place the logo of World Statistics Day at the bottom of their respective homepages, information about World Statistics Day and about the history of ONE will be posted on social networks. ONE's documentation center will host talks with the theme “Better data. Better lives”.

 ONE staff have already been enjoying our happy logo on the wallpaper of their computer screens since August.

posts.title: China will celebrate World Statistics Day with a high-level seminar in Xi'an
posts.text:
[The United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD)] (http://unstats.un.org) and [the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) of China] (http://www.stats.gov.cn) will jointly organize the Celebratory Event of the Second World Statistics Day in Xi’an, China, with the theme of  “Better data. Better lives”.

 [Mr. Wu Hongbo, United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Economic and Social Affairs] (https://www.un.org/development/desa/statements/usg-wu.html), Mr. Wang Baoan, Commissioner of NBS of China, Mr. Stefan Schweinfest, Director of UNSD, and senior officials of Shaanxi Province will attend the celebratory event. Senior officials and statisticians from over 50 countries and international organizations were expected to join the celebration in China.

 The celebratory event will feature keynote speeches for the Second World Statistics Day, a short movie on China’s international statistical training activities, the signing of cooperative document between the United Nations and China, book presentation on a New English-Chinese and Chinese-English Dictionary of Statistics and slides show on the achievements of statistical education and much more.

posts.title: The U.S. portal for statistics - FedStats is reaching out to data users with new materials
posts.text:
FedStats provides access to the full range of official statistics produced by the federal government of the United States. Continuously updated, the FedStats Showcase page will release a range of new products and features to celebrate World Statistics Day 2015. These include links to all the agencies in the U.S. Federal Statistical System, examples of new data tools and web apps, API information for developers, and details about mobile apps.

In addition, FedStats will release two new videos: one describing innovative data tools and apps now available from Federal statistical agencies, and the other highlighting the many achievements of America’s largest statistical agency, the U.S. Census Bureau. posts.title: Lithuania will celebrate with a conference and cooperate with the Vilnius College of Design to create infographics
posts.text:
[Statistics Lithuania] (http://www.stat.gov.lt) will organise different events to celebrate the second World Statistics Day: an official celebratory conference in the Government Office hall, a team building trip for statisticians to famous places of Lithuania, a workshop with design students, and many smaller events.

posts.title: National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico (INEGI) will celebrate World Statistics Day
posts.text:
As part of its programme of activities to commemorate the World Statistics Day on 20 October 2010, Mexico's National Institute of Statistics and Geography, [INEGI] (http://www.inegi.org.mx/) is co-organizing [the 5th OECD World Forum on Statistics, Knowledge and Policy] (http://www.oecd-5wf.mx/), which will take place from 13 to 15 October 2015 in Guadalajara.

 In addition, INEGI will launch a new web portal with many improvements over its current site, including a new data classification focused on user needs instead of organizational structure, a modern and lighter graphic design, and support for mobile devices.

 INEGI is also planning to introduce soon the use of video-bulletins to disseminate official communications on its products and activities, which cover areas of great relevance such as National Census, National Surveys and Administrative Records. The video-bulletins will use a presenter and background images to disseminate information that the Institute already makes available via written press releases. The video-bulletins are short clips, no longer than a minute and a half and will be in compatible format so that media can easily use them.

posts.title: Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics will hold an international event to celebrate World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
The [Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics(PCBS)](http://www.pcbs.gov.ps/wsd-2015/en-us/) will celebrate this year’s World Statistics Day by organizing an international event that highlights emerging issues and challenges in official statistics. With this, the PCBS builds on the successful international conference PCBS it organized on the first World Statistics Day on 20 October 2010.

This year’s conference will consist of activities and events that highlight the role of official statistics to the progress of society. The event will witness the launching of the regional Code of Practices (COP). It will also highlight the [Sustainable Development Goal indicators](http://unstats.un.org/sdgs/) from different views and perspectives, emphasize future core competencies in National Statistics (i.e. data visualization, utilization of big data, spatial data), discuss strategies to cope with information revolution and focus on advance innovation and analysis.

The conference will include reputable keynote speakers, panel discussions, data visualization shows, videos and much more. Conference participants will experience World Statistics Day with a Palestinian flavor with field trips to Palestinian historical and religious sites. Participants will include representatives of Arab and International Statistical Institutions, as well as international experts in the field of official statistics in addition to official research institutions as well as local and international media agencies. The Conference will be held at the Palestine Red Crescent Society HQ in Ramallah from 19-22 October 2015.

posts.title: Germany puts the focus on users with the launch of a new portal
posts.text:
[Destatis](https://www.destatis.de/DE/Startseite.html), Germany’s national statistical office, will launch its new online portal “StatistikCampus” on 20 October this year. The portal is a special service focusing on users from academia featuring data for research, public use data as well as relevant services and events.

To foster statistical literacy, Destatis, in cooperation with the [German Statistical Society (DStatG)](http://www.dstatg.de/en/home/) will organize a conference [“Understanding Statistics”](http://www.dstatg.de/de/startseite/aktuelle-news/article/24-wissenschaftliches-kolloquium-statistik-verstehen-orientierung-in-der-informationsgesellschaf/) on 19-20 November 2015. The conference will provide a forum for a dialogue between official statistics and their users from academia, government and the private sector. During the conference, Destatis will also honor the winners of this year’s [Gerhard-Fuerst-Preis](https://www.destatis.de/DE/UeberUns/UnsereAufgaben/GerhardFuerstPreis/GerhardFuerstPreis.html;jsessionid=9C8FF1C087EE24A655D2749A80100D03.cae4). The Gerhard-Fuerst-Preis is awarded annually for outstanding Ph.D., master and bachelor theses in the area of official statistics.

posts.title: The Swiss Statistical Society will celebrate World Statistics Day with a seminar on "Better data. Better lives."

posts.title: European Central Bank will celebrate World Statistics Day with a conference entitled "European Statistics by the European System of Central Banks"

posts.title: Turkish Institute of Statistics to celebrate World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Turkish Institute of Statistics (Turkstat)](http://www.turkstat.gov.tr/) will celebrate this year’s World Statistics Day in many different ways. On 20 October, Turkstat will hold a panel discussion on “Better data. Better lives.” focusing on the importance of reliable statistics. The panellists are Izak Atiyas (from academia), Prof.Dr. Güngör Uras (a journalist) and Mr. Tarhan Erdem (from research). The event will take place at Turkstat. In addition, all 26 regional offices will organise similar panels in collaboration with universities.

The office also prepared a range of advocacy material, incl. an article on the “Statistical System of Turkey: Past, Present and Future”, an interview with the director of Turkstat on the development of the national statistical system and a speech of the director launching World Statistics Day. Turkstat is also preparing a special press release “Statistics on Statistics” for the special day. Publicity material such as notepads and posters will be distributed in October and one lucky school in Ankara will receive a visit from Turkstat staff and receive an IT donation. A dedicated website will be released by Turkstat by the end of September.

posts.title: Hong Kong, China, celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
To promote the [World Statistics Day 2015](http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/statistical_literacy/wsd2015/index.jsp) and 2016 Population By-census, [the Census and Statistics Department](http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/) took part in [Hong Kong Book Fair 2015](http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/pastprojects/bf2015/index.jsp) held from 15-21 July 2015 at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wan Chai.

The Department's booth was located at the General Books Pavilion and exhibited panels giving details of the World Statistics Day 2015 and the 2016 Population By-census. The Department received favourable responses from the public, as visitors came to the booth to try the e-questionnaire of the 2016 Population By-census and play a challenging interactive computer quiz game.

Another initiative in the context of World Statistics Day 2015 was the delivery of a statistical talk on [“Understanding Innovation and Technology Statistics”](http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/statistical_literacy/wsd2015/uits/index.jsp) at the Lecture Hall of the Hong Kong Science Museum on 5 September 2015. The speaker, Ms Alvina KWAN, Senior Statistician, outlined the salient features of the innovation and technology statistics compiled by the Census and Statistics Department during the talk.

On 20 October, the Census and Statistics Department will jointly organise a public lecture with the [Hong Kong Statistical Society](http://www.hkss.org.hk/) and [the Education Bureau](http://www.edb.gov.hk/en/) in celebration of the second World Statistics Day. Session topics include: (1) Changing Trends of Hong Kong’s Population and the Demographic Challenges Ahead, (2) Better Data – Better Policies, (3) Statistical Finance: Everything you want to know but are afraid to ask. The event will be held from 14:30-16:30 at the Lecture Hall of the Hong Kong Science Museum. For more details please visit [here](http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/statistical_literacy/wsd2015/public_lecture/index.jsp).

posts.title: Statistics Views and Wiley are sponsoring a data visualization competition

posts.title: World Statistics Day button popular at the Joint Statistical Meetings (JSM) in Seattle and the ISI World Statistics Congress (WSC) in Rio de Janeiro
posts.text:
Buttons promoting this year’s celebration of World Statistics Day (WSD) were a hot commodity at recent national and international meetings: Buttons were distributed at the [2015 Joint Statistical Meetings (JSM)](https://www.amstat.org/meetings/jsm/2015/) in Seattle as well as the [2015 ISI World Statistics Congress](http://www.isi2015.org/) in Rio. 

In Seattle, the buttons were handed out at the [American Statistical Association’s](http://www.amstat.org/) booth in the heavily trafficked Exhibit Hall. Many JSM 2015 attendees were spotted around the convention center and on streets nearby sporting the WSD button. More than 6,800 people attended the largest gathering of statisticians in the world and were introduced to WSD 15 during the event. 

The 60th World Statistics Congress took place in Rio de Janeiro. This bi-annual conference was attended by more than 1500 participants from more than 100 countries. Almost 1000 buttons were distributed at the [ISI booth](http://www.isi-web.org/) and could be seen around around the Riocentro, where 1,250 papers were presented in 282 sessions.

posts.title: Statistics Canada invites staff to take trip to the future
posts.text:
[Statistics Canada]( http://www.statcan.gc.ca/eng/wsd/index#a2) employees will be celebrating World Statistics Day in a special way. The agency invited their staff to submit their vision of the future of their agency and how it will look like in 2035. A group of selected employees will present to their co-workers their vision. The event will be broadcast to all Statistics Canada staff across the country. A reverse time capsule will be produced, so employees in 2035 can watch it during their own World Statistics Day celebration! 

Statistics Canada will also be hosting a panel discussion in Ottawa on official health statistics. First, a presentation will provide an overview of the Canadian Health Measures Survey and its objectives, collection processes and dissemination strategy. A panel discussion with Canadian experts from the public and private sectors will follow, along with audience questions. The session will focus on how health data are being used to address important health research questions and to develop emerging health-related policies. 

Statistics Canada is also busy preparing support material for their events, such as web and intranet sites, videos, and other communications pieces.

posts.title: American Statistical Association and the Association of Public Data Users to host webinar on "Statistics for the World of Open Data"
posts.text:
In commemoration of World Statistics Day, Mark Elbert of the [Energy Information Administration (EIA)](http://www.eia.gov) and Jay Meisenheimer of the [Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)](http://www.bls.gov) will talk about the exciting innovate ways their agencies are making their data available to the public to make it more accessible, insightful, and appealing. Meisenheimer will discuss how BLS uses data visualizations to tell interesting stories about the labor market and economy and Elbert will discuss how EIA uses relational metadata to create a data-ecosystem of interlinked online query tools, interactive charts and maps, and a robust open data program. 

The event is cosponsored by the [American Statistical Association](http://www.amstat.org) and the [Association of Public Data Users](http://apdu.org). For more information and to register go [here](http://www.amstat.org/education/weblectures/index.cfm#SWOD) and [here](http://apdu.org/2015/08/03/statistics-for-the-world-of-open-data/).

posts.title: 2015 marks the bicentenary of the birth of George Boole
posts.text:
In its resolution declaring 20 October 2015 as [the second World Statistics Day](https://worldstatisticsday.org/2015/06/03/general-assembly-resolution/), the United Nations General Assembly noted that this year also marks the bicentenary of the birth of George Boole, whose work on the application of the principles of logic as a form of algebra underpins modern computer science. A new 58-minute film commissioned by [University College Cork](http://www.ucc.ie/en/) shines new light on the legacy of George Boole, recognised as the forefather of the information age.

The huge impact of George Boole’s work on technology today is explored in [The Genius of George Boole](http://www.georgeboole.com/film/), a stunning new film narrated by Oscar-winning actor Jeremy Irons and produced by multi award-winning Oxford Film and Television. It assembles academics and industry leaders from across the globe to explore the life and importance of one of the world’s greatest unsung heroes.

World-renowned film producer and Ireland’s digital champion, Lord Puttnam, sets film with the question: “Is George Boole important?” Puttnam continues: “I guess, no George Boole, no Google, no Amazon, no Intel…that makes him pretty important,” leaving no doubt that Boole is indeed a key figure in our digital age. Dealing with the themes of genius and what motivates genius, the film looks at Boole’s legacy with special references to how Boole research has been applied in today’s world. The film also touches on the historic contexts of Ireland, Cork and UCC as well as England in the early nineteenth century.

The film, which was recently shown on national television in Ireland, will be shown at the United Nations HQ in New York on World Statistics Day courtesy of the [University College Cork](http://www.ucc.ie/en/) in cooperation with the [Permanent Mission of Ireland to the United Nations](https://www.dfa.ie/pmun/newyork/).

posts.title: Philippine Statistical System celebrates World Statistics Day and the 26th National Statistics Month in October

Spearheaded by the [Philippine Statistics Authority](https://psa.gov.ph) ,[the Philippine Statistical System](http://nap.psa.gov.ph/pss/default.asp) has developed a rich programme to celebrate their [26th National Statistics Month](http://nap.psa.gov.ph/nsm/26thNSM/default.asp) and the Second World Statistics Day this October.

Celebration on the national level features an exhibit of Official Statistics in the Philippines, a Statistics Fair and the release of an audio-visual presentation on the milestones of the [Philippine Statistical System](http://nap.psa.gov.ph/pss/default.asp). Streamers, tarpaulins and posters promoting the [26th National Statistics Month](http://nap.psa.gov.ph/nsm/26thNSM/default.asp) and 2nd World Statistics Day will be displayed on the facades of government buildings across the country.

The exhibit of Official Statistics in the Philippines is aimed at showcasing the equipment, survey questionnaires, publications, advocacy materials used over the years, as well other information on the history of the statistics and statistical operations in the country. The exhibit will be on display in the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA) Office in CVEA Building (Quezon City) throughout the month of October. The statistics fair aims at increasing public awareness on statistics as well as promoting the statistics profession among students as well as increasing appreciation among government planners about statistics’ importance in planning and decision-making.

Other planned national and local events include: symposia, a photography contest and a statistics quiz. You can find more details on these an many other interesting activities [here](/files/WSD_Philippines_Activities.pdf) .

posts.title: Former U.S. Labor Statistics Commissioners to be inducted into Labor Hall of Honor on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [U.S. Department of Labor](http://www.dol.gov/) will induct [Bureau of Labor Statistics](http://www.bls.gov/home.htm) Commissioners [Carroll D. Wright](http://www.bls.gov/bls/history/commissioners/wright.htm) and [Janet L. Norwood](http://www.bls.gov/bls/history/commissioners/norwood.htm) into the [Labor Hall of Honor](http://www.dol.gov/dol/aboutdol/hallofhonor/) on Tuesday, 20 October 2015 at 11 a.m.

Carroll Wright was the first BLS Commissioner, serving from 1885 to 1905. Janet Norwood, who passed away recently, was the first woman to serve as BLS Commissioner and led the Bureau for 12 crucial years (1979-1991), modernizing it and raising the profile of its work. Both former Commissioners ensured BLS produced the high quality of statistics necessary to the proper functioning of a democratic government. This will be the first time BLS Commissioners will be inducted into the Labor Hall of Honor.

The Hall of Honor was established in 1988 to honor those Americans whose distinctive contributions in the field of labor have elevated working conditions, wages, and over-all quality of life of America’s working families. Recent inductees include former U.S. Senator [Edward “Ted” M. Kennedy](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EiRPjwRtOGg) and the [Chinese Railroad Workers](http://www.dol.gov/dol/aboutdol/hallofhonor/2014_railroad.htm).

During their time as Commissioner, Wright and Norwood each strongly emphasized the necessity of accurate data to help workers suffering from economic hardships. Their legacy lives on as the tangible results of their many accomplishments still impact workers today. On World Statistics Day, we look forward to honoring the achievements of both Wright and Norwood during the Hall of Honor Induction Ceremony.

posts.title: Belarus celebrates 95 years of official statistics and World Statistics Day this year
posts.text:
This year marks the 95th anniversary of Belarus’ [Central Statistical Bureau (Belstat)](http://www.belstat.gov.by/en/). To celebrate this anniversary and the second World Statistics Day, the Bureau has launched a series of contests and activities that promote and encourage user engagement.

A first contest, entitled “My profession is statistician”, provides young statisticians the opportunity to present their profession to the general public from their own view point and experience. A second, entitled “Statistics for All”, and invites students of the [Belarus State Economics University](http://www.bseu.by/english/) to create infographics and analytical reviews that help make statistical information and insights accessible to everybody.

The Bureau is also organizing a “Day of Accessible Official Statistical Information” in the central office of BelStat as well as in the regional statistical offices. Secondary school students in their final year will get a special treat with a “Welcome Day” at Belstat. In addition, the Bureau is preparing a press release on the occasion of World Statistics Day 2015, and a new leaflet “Guide to the website of Belstat”. The World Statistics Day logo will feature prominently on the cover of various statistical publications of Belstat.

To reach as many users as possible, items about the celebration of the World Statistics Day will be included in agendas of thematic seminars and roundtables with users, respondents and academia organized by Belstat and Regional Statistical Offices over the next few weeks.

posts.title: 18 November is African Statistics Day
posts.text:
On 18 November every year, African countries celebrate [African Statistics Day (ASD)](http://www.uneca.org/asd2015) to raise public awareness about the importance of statistics in supporting decision making in all dimensions of sustainable development. This celebration provides an opportunity for each country to take stock of its achievements and challenges in monitoring progress towards national, regional and global development goals.

The theme of the African Statistics Day this year is “Better data for better lives: Harnessing modern technology to enhance national statistical systems”. In this way, the African continent is linking to the World Statistics Day 2015 global celebration, with a renewed call to strengthen the continent’s national statistical systems that will be responsible for providing key information to follow up and review the new [2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development](http://www.un.org/ga/search/view_doc.asp?symbol=A/69/L.85&Lang=E).

Do not forget to check out this [timeline visualization of history of official statistics in Africa](https://cdn.knightlab.com/libs/timeline/latest/embed/index.html?source=1VfSdtK8FOT7BRNAr8Sx7Nd10GTDd1OnymbKbE9aPiGk&font=Bevan-PotanoSans&maptype=toner&lang=en&height=650). For feedback and further inquiries kindly contact: Mr. Joseph Tinfissi ILBOUDO, Chief of Statistical Development Section of African Centre for Statistics (ACS) using [jilboudo@uneca.org](mailto:jilboudo@uneca.org).

posts.title: Secretary-General of the United Nations invites governments to celebrate World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
In a letter to the heads of state dated 19 August 2015, the Secretary-General of the United Nations, Mr. Ban Ki-moon, invited governments around the World to lend their full and timely support to make the 2015 World Statistics Day a success, and encouraged them to share with the global community their plans in relation to this celebration.

The Secretary-General pointed out in his letter that "statistics are critical for evidence-based decision making across all cultural and historical backgrounds of countries and irrespective of their level of development." He also noted that, by [designating 20 October 2015 as World Statistic Day](https://worldstatisticsday.org/2015/06/03/general-assembly-resolution/) under the general theme "Better data, better lives", the United Nations General Assembly "acknowledged the fundamental importance of sustainable national statistical capacity to produce reliable and timely statistics and indicators." The [General Assembly](http://www.un.org/en/ga/) is the main deliberative, policymaking and representative organ of the United Nations.

In his message to all heads of state, the Secretary-General underlined that "solid data are an indispensable basis for informed policy formulation and for monitoring the post-2015 development agenda at the national, regional and international levels." This aspect has particular significance today, as countries are finalizing more than two years of preparations which will culminate next month in the United Nations [summit](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/summit) for the adoption of the post-2015 development agenda, making a clear call for "quality, accessible, timely and reliable disaggragated data... to help with the measurement of progress and to ensure no one is left behind."

The full text of the Secretary-General's letter is available here:

*   [English](files/Ltr-SG-E.pdf)
*   [French](files/Ltr-SG-F.pdf)
*   [Spanish](files/Ltr-SG-S.pdf)

posts.title: Put your creativity to the test joining our Data Visualization Challenge
posts.text:
Following the launch of the [2015 Millennium Development Goals Report](http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/Default.aspx), the United Nations Statistics Division is excited to announce the [#WSD2015 Data Visualization Challenge competition](https://unite.un.org/ideas/content/wsd2015-data-visualization-challenge) as part of the celebration around the World Statistics Day 2015.

In this competition, we challenge you to use your creativity and imagination to help answer a question relevant for development policy, by building an infographic or dynamic visualization featuring the latest data from the [2015 MDG report](http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/Default.aspx). For instance:

*   Find interlinkages, synergies and tradeoffs between different MDG goals and targets
*   Identify factors that help explain different levels of achievement across countries and regions
*   Or come up with your own questions to put your analytical and data visualization skills to the test!

The winner will be announced on 20 October 2015 - World Statistics Day 2015! A selection of the best visualizations received will be showcased on the [UNSD website](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/default.htm), as well as on the [Unite Ideas](https://unite.un.org/ideas/) website and other platforms worldwide.

To learn more about the rules and ways of participating in this Data Visualization Challenge, visit [Unite Ideas](https://unite.un.org/ideas/) and follow this [link](https://unite.un.org/ideas/WSD2015).

posts.title: General Assembly adopts World Statistics Day Resolution
posts.text:
On 3 June 2015, the [United Nations General Assembly](http://www.un.org/ga/) adopted a resolution officially designating 20 October 2015 as the second World Statistics Day, under the general theme "Better data. Better lives". In addition, the General Assembly decided to celebrate World Statistics Day on 20 October every five years.

This resolution, which was co-sponsored by Hungary and 96 other Member States, follows the recommendation by the [United Nations Statistical Commission at its 46th session](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/statcom/sc2015.htm) to celebrate 20 October 2015 as World Statistics Day. H.E. Ambassador Bogyay of Hungary delivered a [statement introducing the draft resolution](https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B8n3WhOaTbGVQUlwMjJtcWtQZjQ/edit) to the General Assembly before its adoption.

In the resolution, the General Assembly invites all Member States, members of specialized agencies, organizations of the United Nations system and other international and regional organizations, as well as civil society, including non-governmental organizations, such as research institutions, media and all producers and users of official statistics, to observe World Statistics Day.

The full text of the World Statistics Day resolution is available in the six official languages of the United Nations:

posts.title: October 2015 Issue of Significance Magazine to be devoted to World Statistics Day
posts.text:
To mark World Statistics Day, [Significance Magazine](http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance) will devote its October 2015 issue to articles highlighting important contributions of statistics in different parts of the world. Significance Magazine is an official publication of both the [Royal Statistical Society (RSS)](http://www.rss.org.uk/) and the [American Statistical Association (ASA)](http://www.amstat.org/).

The magazine is planning to publish one article from each of the main geographic regions: North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia.

We are particularly keen that articles published about the developing world do not fall into the "bad news" trap - that is, focusing only on stories of war, death, disease, poverty, and natural disasters,"says Significance Editor Brian Tarran. Instead, the magazine is seeking tales of interesting work and novel applications of statistics from parts of the planet that are too often overlooked by the media, he adds.

You can send your article ideas or recommendations of potential contributors to Brian at [b.tarran@rss.org.uk](mailto:b.tarran@rss.org.uk).

posts.title: World Statistics Day 2015 Logo Launch
posts.text:
The campaign for World Statistics Day 2015, which will take place on 20 October 2015, was officially launched today during the [46th Session of the UN Statistical Commission](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/statcom/commission_46th_session.htm) with the theme "Better data. Better lives". During the launch the official logo was revealed with an animation.

The logo is a play on a percentage symbol (representing statistics) and a smiling face. It evokes the idea of how statistics inform and support people around the world and thus contribute to achieve a healthy and happy society.

2015, the year of the second World Statistics Day, marks an important cornerstone for official statistics, with the conclusion of the [Millennium Development Goals](http://mdgs.un.org/), the beginning of the [post-2015 development agenda](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015), the ongoing [data revolution](http://www.undatarevolution.org/), preparations for the 2020 World Population and Housing Census Programme and so much more.

The [first World Statistics Day](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/wsd/) was commemorated on 20 October 2010 in over 130 countries and areas. World Statistics Day 2015 will be celebrated globally with local events organized by national statistical offices, statistical organizations, UN organizations and universities.

This website features all events for World Statistics Day 2015. To showcase your event on this website or for questions and comments get in touch at [statistics@un.org](mailto:statistics@un.org).
